meanings.sent1: After forgetting some math concepts, she reeducated herself by reviewing old textbooks.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reeducated the students on proper lab safety procedures.
meanings.sent3: He thought he was a math genius until he had to be reeducated on basic algebra.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a blank canvas waiting to be reeducated with new knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The process of being reeducated can be both challenging and rewarding.

meanings.definition: To teach (someone) new skills or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The workshop aimed to reeducate participants on effective communication techniques.
meanings.sent2: The mentor reeducated the apprentice on traditional woodworking methods.
meanings.sent3: She had to reeducate herself on the importance of patience after a hectic day.
meanings.sent4: Learning a new language can feel like being reeducated in a whole new way of thinking.
meanings.sent5: The experience of being reeducated can open up exciting opportunities for personal growth.
